## VariableMap.getVariable() method

Find the variable by the given name and type and return it. Return null if it is not found.

**Signature:**

```typescript
getVariable(name: string, opt_type?: string): IVariableModel<IVariableState> | null;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  name | string | The name to check for. |
|  opt\_type | string | _(Optional)_ The type of the variable. If not provided it defaults to the empty string, which is a specific type. |

**Returns:**

[IVariableModel](./blockly.ivariablemodel_interface.md)<!-- -->&lt;[IVariableState](./blockly.ivariablestate_interface.md)<!-- -->&gt; \| null

The variable with the given name, or null if it was not found.
